vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
1. Hellen , son of Deucalion, [8th/7th c.BC]
2. the Ἕλληνες of [8th/7th c.BC] are the Thessalian tribe of which Hellen was the reputed chief (compare Ἑλλάς 1), [8th/7th c.BC]
3. later, Ἕλληνες was the regularly name for Greeks , opposite to βάρβαροι, [Refs 5th c.BC], etc.
4. later still, of Gentiles , Opp. to Jews, [Refs 1st c.AD]
5. as adjective = Ἑλληνικός, [Refs 5th c.BC], etc.:—;even with a fem. Substantive, [6th/5th c.BC, Refs 5th c.BC] (Middle Liddel)
vocabInfos.shortDef: Greek; Gentile, a class of person distinguished from the Jewish race and nation (not necessarily Greek)
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.10.2;
son of: Japheth (H3315);
brother of: Gomer (H1586), Magog (H4031), Madai (H4074), Tubal (H8422), Meshech (H4902) and Tiras (H8494);
father of: Elishah (H0473), Tarshish (H8659), Kittim (H3794) and Dodanim (H1721); also called Greek at Jol.3.6 & NT.
§ Greek; Gentile, a class of person distinguished from the Jewish race and nation (not necessarily Greek)
a Greek, Acts 18:17; Rom. 1:14; one not a Jew, a Gentile, Acts 14:1; 16:1, 3
vocabInfos._es_Definition: un griego ; persona no judía, gentil, pagano
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 希臘的 (人民, 語言, 文化)
2) 外邦人, 異教徒, 非猶太人
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 希腊的 (人民, 语言, 文化)
2) 外邦人, 异教徒, 非犹太人
